ðŸ”¥ virtualbox-web-panel | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing VirtualBox virtual machines through a web browser.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ List VMs â€¢ Control Actions (start, stop, save state) â€¢ Keystroke Injection â€¢ Screenshot Capture â€¢ VM Status Indicator
ðŸ“– Summary: The VirtualBox Web Control Panel provides a web interface to manage VirtualBox virtual machines. It allows users to list, control, and interact with VMs by starting, stopping, saving state, sending keystrokes, and viewing live screenshots. The panel is designed to be lightweight and easy to deploy, requiring only Python 3's standard libraries and `VBoxManage`.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ meeting-minutes | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automatically capturing, transcribing, and summarizing meeting content locally, ensuring user privacy and eliminating the need for external servers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Live meeting audio capture â€¢ Real-time transcription â€¢ AI-powered meeting summaries â€¢ Local device processing for privacy
ðŸ“– Summary: The meeting-minutes repository provides an AI-powered meeting assistant that captures live audio, transcribes it in real-time, and generates summaries. It's designed to run locally on user devices, ensuring privacy. The application supports macOS and Windows, with Linux support planned, and aims to automate meeting note-taking and summarization.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ caps-log | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Personal journaling with a focus on tracking habits and activities through tag and section-based organization and visualization.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Terminal-based journaling â€¢ Markdown log storage â€¢ Section and tag extraction for menu display â€¢ Calendar highlighting based on tag/section selection â€¢ Integration with `$EDITOR` for log editing
ðŸ“– Summary: Caps-Log is a terminal-based journaling tool that stores entries as Markdown files. It extracts sections and tags to create interactive menus, allowing users to visualize their activities on a calendar. The tool also supports integration with external editors, remote storage via Git, and AES encryption for logs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ cua | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling AI agents to control full operating systems within high-performance, lightweight virtual containers for tasks like interacting with applications, browsing the web, and writing code.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ High-performance virtualization using Apple's Virtualization.Framework â€¢ Framework for AI agents to observe and control virtual environments
ðŸ“– Summary: Cua is a framework that provides high-performance virtualization and a computer-use interface for AI agents. It allows AI systems to observe and control virtual macOS or Linux environments on Apple Silicon with near-native performance. This enables secure, reproducible, and flexible AI agent workflows with built-in LLM integration.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ hector-rag | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for AI-driven applications using PostgreSQL as a vector database.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiple RAG retrieval methods (Similarity Search, Keyword Search, Graph Retrieval, KAG) â€¢ Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) for combining multiple retrieval methods â€¢ Built on PostgreSQL vector database â€¢ Modular architecture
ðŸ“– Summary: Hector RAG is a modular RAG framework built on PostgreSQL, offering advanced retrieval methods and fusion techniques. It enables developers to create sophisticated RAG pipelines for AI applications, leveraging the efficiency of PostgreSQL for vector storage and retrieval. The framework supports multiple retrieval methods and Reciprocal Rank Fusion for enhanced accuracy.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ florisboard | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A customizable, privacy-focused keyboard for Android devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Integrated clipboard manager / history â€¢ Advanced theming support and customization â€¢ Integrated extension support â€¢ Emoji keyboard / history / suggestions
ðŸ“– Summary: FlorisBoard is an open-source keyboard for Android that prioritizes user privacy and customization. It offers features like a clipboard manager, advanced theming, extension support, and an emoji keyboard. The project is currently in early-beta and aims to be modern and user-friendly.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ faviconic | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Running simple games or animations within a browser tab's favicon.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Runs games inside browser tab favicons â€¢ Uses JavaScript â€¢ Requires a local Python HTTP server to run â€¢ Uses AppleScript to open multiple Chrome windows
ðŸ“– Summary: Faviconic is a JavaScript tool that allows users to run simple games or animations inside a browser tab's favicon. It leverages AppleScript to open multiple Chrome windows and requires a local Python HTTP server to serve the game content. The primary use case is to display simple, visually engaging content within the limited space of a favicon.
